summary: The paper describes a method for deracemizing chiral amines using enzyme-catalyzed oxidation and reduction cycles, focusing on identifying suitable amine oxidases.
key_claims: Deracemization of chiral amines can be achieved through repeated cycles of enzyme-catalyzed oxidation to imines followed by nonselective reduction.

_abstract: Enantiomerically pure chiral amines are valuable synthetic intermediates, particularly for the preparation of pharmaceutical compounds. Traditionally, chiral amines have been obtained by resolution-based procedures, for example, by kinetic resolution of a racemate using an enzyme  [1, 2]  or crystallization of a diastereomer using a chiral acid to form a salt.  [3]  Increasingly, there is a desire to develop asymmetric approaches, or their equivalents, which can in principal deliver the product in 100 % yield and 100 % ee.
